channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping by same man, 2nd October
item.description:
Still the same thing. As a council it is your duty to clean this immediately.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Same fly tipping/ rubbish as always, 2nd October
item.description:
Hackney Council, This is a health and safety concern. Please stop allowing this. Will raise with Ombudsman soon as this is persistent and has been called a public health concern by your own employees

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On west side of Kingsgate road, on north side of Gascony, 2nd October
item.description:
Completely blocked drain very near Kingsgate Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Kingsgate Road, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights on Wimborne Avenue and Berns Way connecting to Wimborne Avenue not working, currently time is 20.00 and not switched on. With the roads in darkness, making it unsafe to walk on the roads without a torch., 2nd October
item.description:
Both roads are in complete darkness at 20.00, making me feel unsafe walking home from work and having to carry a torch. Only light that is being provided is from the houses on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Ravensbury Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council's own rubbish left on Tuscan Road, 2nd October
item.description:
After a sweep of the street, bags of leaves were left in the street. They've been here for a week now. Inevitably, people are now adding their own rubbish. Disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tuscan Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish piling up on Badgemore Path, 2nd October
item.description:
A huge bag of rubbish has been here for over a week no (reported in the day it was dumped). Inevitably, other people are now adding their rubbish and it looks like a dump, with rotting food strewn across the pavement. Disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgemore Path, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Steep hill from hawkwood mount and from the otherside rhat leads onto Holmbury View, 2nd October
item.description:
Stationery parked vehicles are continuously crashed into from cars speeding down the steep hills to either side of Holmbury View, leading to cars being written off. It is only a matter of time before someone is hit. Something needs to be done ASAP!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Holmbury View, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White hazardous substance, 2nd October
item.description:
Possibly paint has been poured and left on the side of the road. It could be hazardous and must be dealt with professionally.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight Timing Issue – Ravensbury Road, 2nd October
item.description:
I would like to report a concern regarding the streetlight on Ravensbury Road. At 19:30 this evening, it was very dark outside and the light had still not switched on. It is possible that the streetlight is turning on later (perhaps after 8:00 pm), but this timing does not provide sufficient lighting for pedestrians and road users during the darker evenings. Could you please investigate whether the timing of this streetlight needs adjustment to ensure it comes on earlier?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Ravensbury Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing manhole cover, 2nd October
item.description:
Manhole located to left on the grass as you enter the park gate is missing. Open access for animal/person to fall in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stephen Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electrical switch box on pavement on east side of Blackheath Village - demolished by vehicle impact, 2nd October
item.description:
Electrical switch box on pavement on east side of Blackheath Village by pedestrian crossing outside railway station - demolished by vehicle impact See photographs ******* PLEASE NOTE THIS MUST BE 6TH TIME IN LAST TWO YEARS - TO PREVENT FYRTHER IMPACTS ASK FM CONWAY TO ADD 2 PROTECTIVE BIOLLARDS IN VICINITY OF BOX **** For avoidance of doubt it is this box: Https://www.instantstreetview.com/@51.465653,0.009119,87.61h,-8.95p,2.7z,maFqrFgZIvhkK1O9mUK-bA Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Blackheath Village, Blackheath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Chunks of concrete and builders waste n blue bin bags

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milk Street, Sundridge, London

item.title: Fly Tipping on pavement, 2nd October
item.description:
A number of household furniture items have been abandoned on the pavement for several weeks, with items added over time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43-48, Vanbrugh Fields, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Street light not working, 2nd October
item.description:
Street lights number 1K 2 is not working and the cul-de-sac is very dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Kenley Close, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Turning circle has weeds, litter not cleaned., 2nd October
item.description:
The road sweeper truck is too big to clean the turning circle. So this area is never cleaned by the council. I am a Pensioner and I’ve been spraying the weeds and sweeping up. But now I can’t physically do this job. Todays sweeper truck cleaned out street beautifully but couldn’t get close enough in the turning circle. So again it’s been left.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Millwood Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress, 2nd October
item.description:
Why do people keep flytipping here?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Inverton Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working at dusk, 2nd October
item.description:
Our street lights aren’t coming on at dusk and continue to stay off until after dark causing some safety and security issues at the top of Ravensbury Road. I think this is also affecting Kevington, Wimborne and Marlings Park / Berens Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Ravensbury Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely dangerous . I have slipped on the debris from the tree outside Emmaus. You can hardly walk on the pavement because of all the crab apples on it & the rd . They are danger9, 2nd October
item.description:
The pavement is covered in debris / crabapples from the tree outside Emmaus . The pavement is dangerous & the debris is a tripping hazard. The tree needs to be removed or pavement & road cleared of all the fallen crab apples before there is a serious accident

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 2nd October
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked here for many months. I feel that is abandoned.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Detmold Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Sofa dumped in Seal Street E8, 2nd October
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seal Street, Hackney, London
